polished_script:
HOOK: Most agents will lose December. Here's why that's your biggest opportunity. [ON-SCREEN: DECEMBER = OPPORTUNITY]

BRAND INTRO: "This is D.J. Paris with Keeping It Real Podcast, and this is your agent tip of the day."

SETUP: Paul Salter coaches top performers using hypnosis and mindset work, and he's watched the same pattern destroy agent momentum every single year. [ON-SCREEN: PAUL SALTER - MINDSET COACH] Your 40-hour weeks become 20, then 10. You tell yourself "the kids have a half day" or "it's too cold" or "no one's buying anyway." All-or-nothing thinking kicks in â€” if you can't do a full day, you do nothing. [ON-SCREEN: 40 HOURS â†’ 20 HOURS â†’ 10 HOURS]
[15-SEC RE-HOOK]: But here's what Paul calls the line between winners and losers.

INSIGHT: Paul calls it interest versus commitment. And here's the line that hits: "If you're committed to your goal, the holidays, the weather, other people's actions leave you absolutely unfazed." [ON-SCREEN: INTEREST vs COMMITMENT] While you're making excuses, motivated buyers and sellers who need to move yesterday are getting ignored. Your competition just went home, but the deals are still there. [ON-SCREEN: MOTIVATED BUYERS IGNORED]

REFRAME: This isn't about grinding through Christmas dinner. While everyone else uses December as an excuse, you use it as separation season. Pick three high-leverage activities â€” not forty, just three â€” and commit to them every single day until January 2nd.

CTA: "Are you using December as separation season or excuse season?"

CLOSE: "See you next time."
